missing_provisions.recommendation: Add specific clauses addressing building safety compliance, fire safety measures, and related cost arrangements.

missing_provisions.title: Flexible Living Arrangements
missing_provisions.description: Modern leases increasingly accommodate home-based working and short-term letting platforms.
missing_provisions.recommendation: Include clear provisions for home office use and regulated short-term letting rights with appropriate safeguards.

missing_provisions.title: Service Charge Transparency
missing_provisions.description: Best practice now includes detailed service charge consultation and reporting requirements.
missing_provisions.recommendation: Include provisions for digital service charge reporting, consultation processes, and reserve fund management.

positive_improvements.title: Enhanced Property Management Rights
positive_improvements.description: The new lease provides clearer guidelines for property management and maintenance responsibilities.
positive_improvements.value_added: Better defined responsibilities reduce potential disputes and ensure proper maintenance.

positive_improvements.title: Structured Fee Framework
positive_improvements.description: Introduction of clear, capped administration fees for assignments and alterations provides transparency.
positive_improvements.value_added: Predictable costs for future transactions and property improvements.

positive_improvements.title: Improved Access Protocol
positive_improvements.description: New 48-hour notice requirement for landlord access ensures better privacy and planning.
positive_improvements.value_added: Enhanced tenant privacy while maintaining necessary property management access.

positive_improvements.title: Structural Maintenance Clarity
positive_improvements.description: Clear definition of structural repair responsibilities and cost-sharing arrangements.
positive_improvements.value_added: Better long-term property maintenance and value preservation.

negotiation_areas.title: Clear Entry Rights
negotiation_areas.description: The new lease includes well-defined landlord entry rights with 48-hour notice period.
negotiation_areas.benefit: Provides clarity and protection for both parties regarding property access.

negotiation_areas.title: Transparent Fee Structure
negotiation_areas.description: Clear administration fees for assignments and alterations with defined caps.
negotiation_areas.benefit: Provides certainty and prevents unexpected costs in the future.

negotiation_areas.title: Reduced Extension Period
negotiation_areas.description: The proposed extension is only 70 years instead of the statutory 90 years.
negotiation_areas.recommendation: Request the full 90-year extension as provided by the Leasehold Reform Act.

negotiation_areas.title: Increased Ground Rent
negotiation_areas.description: The proposed ground rent is higher than the original lease and exceeds market standards.
negotiation_areas.recommendation: Negotiate for a peppercorn (£0) ground rent, which is standard for lease extensions.

negotiation_areas.title: Service Charge Increases
negotiation_areas.description: The service charge cap has increased from RPI+2% to RPI+3.5%.
negotiation_areas.recommendation: Maintain the original cap of RPI+2% or negotiate for RPI only.

negotiation_areas.title: Additional Administration Fees
negotiation_areas.description: New administration fees for assignment, subletting, and alterations have been introduced.
negotiation_areas.recommendation: Request removal of these fees or cap them at a lower rate with inflation protection.

negotiation_areas.title: Maintenance Responsibilities
negotiation_areas.description: Expanded tenant responsibilities for structural repairs without clear cost limits.
negotiation_areas.recommendation: Clarify cost-sharing arrangements and establish reasonable cost limits.

clauses.text: Fixed ground rent at £250 per year

priority_action_items: Consult a lawyer about the escalating ground rent clause
Negotiate the removal of outdated maintenance provisions
Clarify ambiguous service charge adjustments

risk_assessment.description: Your lease contains several concerning clauses that should be addressed before extension.

risk_items.title: Escalating Ground Rent
risk_items.description: Ground rent increases every 10 years, potentially becoming unaffordable.

risk_items.title: Ambiguous Service Charges
risk_items.description: Lack of clarity may lead to unexpected costs.

positive_elements.title: Fixed Ground Rent
positive_elements.description: The ground rent is fixed at a reasonable £250 per year for the initial term, providing cost certainty.

concerning_clauses.title: Escalating Ground Rent
concerning_clauses.description: Ground rent doubles every 10 years, which could become financially burdensome.
concerning_clauses.clause_text: The ground rent shall double every 10 years starting from the commencement date.

recommended_removals.title: Outdated Maintenance Provision
recommended_removals.description: Requires lessee to maintain a coal furnace, which is obsolete.

renegotiation_points.title: Service Charge Clarity
renegotiation_points.description: Ambiguous wording around service charge adjustments needs clarification.

missing_elements.title: Right to Manage
missing_elements.description: No provision for lessees to manage the property, limiting control.

modern_standards.title: Ground Rent Cap
modern_standards.description: Modern leases often cap ground rent at 0.1% of property value.
